main event: Three lights were observed moving erratically at high speeds over Yosemite National Park in California on July 22, 1945.
interesting points: The lights were described as white, bright, and clearly visible against the sky.
The lights moved at speeds faster than a jet aircraft, with a 'slight gyrating or wobbly motion'.
The lights were observed for around 15 seconds, covering an estimated 0.5 minute duration at 60 degrees elevation.
No sound was heard from the lights.
The lights disappeared behind a hill or tree, but their exact path and disappearance was not clearly determined.
sighted object: Three bright white lights moving erratically in the sky
